 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;

 window.onload = function() {

 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I kindly want to inform you about a discrepancy within the safe browsing feature, that said Chrome is assessing links in another way than the (manually) online check.<span class="line"><!---->I kindly want to inform you about a discrepancy within the safe browsing feature, that said Chrome is assessing links in another way than the (manually) online check.<!----></span><br><br>As the "Safe Browsing" ought to be in general a product of Chrome, referring to the blog under<span class="line"><!---->As the "Safe Browsing" ought to be in general a product of Chrome, referring to the blog under<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html"><!---->https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html<!----></a><br><br>you are getting my accidental finding here.<span class="line"><!---->you are getting my accidental finding here.<!----></span><br><br>Behaviour<span class="line"><!---->Behaviour<!----></span><br>=========<span class="line"><!---->=========<!----></span><br><br>Today I got a phishing attempt for the page<span class="line"><!---->Today I got a phishing attempt for the page<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://www<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www"><!---->https://www<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> marlene baß. com/ 452775/ zjnsapc53s<span class="line"><!----> marlene baß. com/ 452775/ zjnsapc53s<!----></span><br>(Spaces were added by me for security reasons, the path cut)<span class="line"><!---->(Spaces were added by me for security reasons, the path cut)<!----></span><br><br>which was handled as follows:<span class="line"><!---->which was handled as follows:<!----></span><br><br>* Chrome<span class="line"><!---->* Chrome<!----></span><br>  ==> successfully blocked as MALICIOUS<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; successfully blocked as MALICIOUS<!----></span><br><br>* Manual check in Google Transparency Report<span class="line"><!---->* Manual check in Google Transparency Report<!----></span><br>  ==> The site would be CLEAN<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; The site would be CLEAN<!----></span><br>  via <span class="line"><!---->  via <!----></span>https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&hl=en<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&amp;hl=en"><!---->https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&amp;hl=en<!----></a><br><br>* Queried with "SS"<span class="line"><!---->* Queried with "SS"<!----></span><br>  ==> Malicious<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; Malicious<!----></span><br><br>Screenshots enclosed.<span class="line"><!---->Screenshots enclosed.<!----></span><br><br><br>Problem<span class="line"><!---->Problem<!----></span><br>==========<span class="line"><!---->==========<!----></span><br><br>The domain obviously contains a German Sharp-S ("ß"), which was translated by Chrome to a double-S ("SS"); thus the block list contains the variant with double-S for the match. So far, so good.<span class="line"><!---->The domain obviously contains a German Sharp-S ("ß"), which was translated by Chrome to a double-S ("SS"); thus the block list contains the variant with double-S for the match. So far, so good.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately, the official Google query mask in the transparency report gives a different result for the provided link, namely that it would be harmless. This is incorrect. Screenshots enclosed.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately, the official Google query mask in the transparency report gives a different result for the provided link, namely that it would be harmless. This is incorrect. Screenshots enclosed.<!----></span><br><br>It gives me the impression that two different algorithms are used here, which lead to different safety-critical results.<span class="line"><!---->It gives me the impression that two different algorithms are used here, which lead to different safety-critical results.<!----></span><br><br>Bad people could use this different handling to their advantage: starting a perfectly layouted phishing campaign as e.g. a bank, with a link to a domain including a "ß" and containing immediately a text hint in the kind of<span class="line"><!---->Bad people could use this different handling to their advantage: starting a perfectly layouted phishing campaign as e.g. a bank, with a link to a domain including a "ß" and containing immediately a text hint in the kind of<!----></span><br><br>"Unfortunately, Chrome is blocking access to the site due to a misconfiguration. We are in contact with Google.<span class="line"><!---->"Unfortunately, Chrome is blocking access to the site due to a misconfiguration. We are in contact with Google.<!----></span><br><br>In the meantime please make sure on the official Google page below<span class="line"><!---->In the meantime please make sure on the official Google page below<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search"><!---->https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search<!----></a><br><br>where Google confirms to you that the site is safe."<span class="line"><!---->where Google confirms to you that the site is safe."<!----></span><br><br>As said, in my experiences many people (at least five in my very direct surrounding) would really believe that and skip Chrome's warning after checking via the transparency report (Why not: "Google tells it, so it's correct. Silly Chrome."). It doesn't matter that Chrome shows the translated "SS" link because the user used the identical link that he inserted into the query. Nobody pays any attention there; it was the same link.<span class="line"><!---->As said, in my experiences many people (at least five in my very direct surrounding) would really believe that and skip Chrome's warning after checking via the transparency report (Why not: "Google tells it, so it's correct. Silly Chrome."). It doesn't matter that Chrome shows the translated "SS" link because the user used the identical link that he inserted into the query. Nobody pays any attention there; it was the same link.<!----></span><br><br>The catastrophe begins.<span class="line"><!---->The catastrophe begins.<!----></span><br><br>Same with subdomains (examples):<span class="line"><!---->Same with subdomains (examples):<!----></span><br>*<span class="line"><!---->*<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com"><!---->blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com<!----></a> => malicous<span class="line"><!----> =&gt; malicous<!----></span><br>* blablablaß.blablablaaaa.com => may be, may be not <span class="line"><!---->* blablablaß.blablablaaaa.com =&gt; may be, may be not <!----></span><br><br>That said, the safe browsing function is obviously implemented improperly. I would like to trust Google and Chrome - but currently it is obviously not guaranteed. :o(<span class="line"><!---->That said, the safe browsing function is obviously implemented improperly. I would like to trust Google and Chrome - but currently it is obviously not guaranteed. :o(<!----></span><br><br>Just a thought: Probably there are also other letters causing a similar issue, in the domain and/or the path. I haven't tried.<span class="line"><!---->Just a thought: Probably there are also other letters causing a similar issue, in the domain and/or the path. I haven't tried.<!----></span><br><br>I hope it is clear enough.<span class="line"><!---->I hope it is clear enough.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><br><br><br>* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32-bit)<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32-bit)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm not sure whether this is expected or not because I don't know all the rules about how unicode domains work. If marlenebaß is a different domain from marlenebass, then the site probably redirect you. Then we showed an interstitial warning on marlenebass. In this case, Safe Browsing is correctly reporting that it doesn't see phishing on marlenebaß, only on marlenebass.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure whether this is expected or not because I don't know all the rules about how unicode domains work. If marlenebaß is a different domain from marlenebass, then the site probably redirect you. Then we showed an interstitial warning on marlenebass. In this case, Safe Browsing is correctly reporting that it doesn't see phishing on marlenebaß, only on marlenebass.<!----></span><br><br>On the other hand, if these domains are "the same" in some sense (particularly if Chrome is just doing an ASCII-only display of marlenebaß), then Safe Browsing should probably report the same thing on both.<span class="line"><!---->On the other hand, if these domains are "the same" in some sense (particularly if Chrome is just doing an ASCII-only display of marlenebaß), then Safe Browsing should probably report the same thing on both.<!----></span><br><br>+meacer@, chtomp@ for URL display knowledge - are these two domains the same or different?<span class="line"><!---->+meacer@, chtomp@ for URL display knowledge - are these two domains the same or different?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

      OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)" hidden=""><!---->OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)<!----></div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think this is a case where Safe Browsing is applying full IDNA2008 (which maintains "ß" the sharp-S unicode character) but Chrome applies IDNA2003/IDN2008-Transitional which normalizes it to "ss". We are in the process of changing this in Chrome to fully move to IDNA2008.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a case where Safe Browsing is applying full IDNA2008 (which maintains "ß" the sharp-S unicode character) but Chrome applies IDNA2003/IDN2008-Transitional which normalizes it to "ss". We are in the process of changing this in Chrome to fully move to IDNA2008.<!----></span><br><br>What this means is that, in Chrome today for the example domain "faß[.]de" will result in navigating to "fass[.]de". But entering "faß[.]de" in the Safe Browsing tool appears to be referring to the Unicode version (i.e., in Punycode "xn--fa-hia.de") maintaining the sharp-S.<span class="line"><!---->What this means is that, in Chrome today for the example domain "faß[.]de" will result in navigating to "fass[.]de". But entering "faß[.]de" in the Safe Browsing tool appears to be referring to the Unicode version (i.e., in Punycode "xn--fa-hia.de") maintaining the sharp-S.<!----></span><br><br>These are different domains so they can have different results Arguably, full IDNA2008 is "more correct", which is why we're moving Chrome to it. It also aligns us with other browsers. (And this can definitely get added to our list of reasons the switch is helpful.)<span class="line"><!---->These are different domains so they can have different results Arguably, full IDNA2008 is "more correct", which is why we're moving Chrome to it. It also aligns us with other browsers. (And this can definitely get added to our list of reasons the switch is helpful.)<!----></span><br><br>As a stopgap or clarifying measure, it might be helpful for the Safe Browsing page to output the final URL that was checked after normalization. There are a number of other cases where the normalization step can differ depending on URL library, etc. so including this can be a good confirmatory signal that the user is looking at the correct domain/URL.<span class="line"><!---->As a stopgap or clarifying measure, it might be helpful for the Safe Browsing page to output the final URL that was checked after normalization. There are a number of other cases where the normalization step can differ depending on URL library, etc. so including this can be a good confirmatory signal that the user is looking at the correct domain/URL.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        Thanks for the details! I do think this social engineering attack is reasonably plausible, since a user copy-pasting a link into the transparency report would see the link as "safe". I've filed a bug internally <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the details! I do think this social engineering attack is reasonably plausible, since a user copy-pasting a link into the transparency report would see the link as "safe". I've filed a bug internally <!----></span>(<span class="line"><!---->(<!----></span>b/249607932<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://b/249607932"><!---->b/249607932<!----></a>) asking them to run IDNA2003 instead or in addition until we've moved over. I've marked this bug as ExternalDependency as a result.<span class="line"><!---->) asking them to run IDNA2003 instead or in addition until we've moved over. I've marked this bug as ExternalDependency as a result.<!----></span><br><br>Triaging this as low severity, since a full bypass of interstitials would be medium, and this uses social engineering to achieve that result.<span class="line"><!---->Triaging this as low severity, since a full bypass of interstitials would be medium, and this uses social engineering to achieve that result.<!----></span><br><br>cthomp@ - assigning to you because the only action Chrome might take here is to migrate to IDNA2008.<span class="line"><!---->cthomp@ - assigning to you because the only action Chrome might take here is to migrate to IDNA2008.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry for the lack of updates here. There haven't been any changes internally to the Safe Browsing query system, but we have shipped IDNA 2008 Non-Transitional in Chrome for these cases, so I think Chrome should now be in alignment with the Safe Browsing query system.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for the lack of updates here. There haven't been any changes internally to the Safe Browsing query system, but we have shipped IDNA 2008 Non-Transitional in Chrome for these cases, so I think Chrome should now be in alignment with the Safe Browsing query system.<!----></span><br><br>Closing this as Fixed based on the status of <span class="line"><!---->Closing this as Fixed based on the status of <!----></span>Issue 694157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=694157" title="Use IDNA 2008 with non-transitional processing"><!---->Issue 694157<!----></a>. My understanding is there is some follow-up work needed on <span class="line"><!---->. My understanding is there is some follow-up work needed on <!----></span>Issue 694157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=694157" title="Use IDNA 2008 with non-transitional processing"><!---->Issue 694157<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>specifically for ZWJ/ZWNJ, but for U+00DF LATIN SMALL LETTER SHARP S and U+03C2 GREEK SMALL LETTER FINAL SIGMA we should now be in alignment with both other browser and with the Safe Browsing query system.<span class="line"><!---->specifically for ZWJ/ZWNJ, but for U+00DF LATIN SMALL LETTER SHARP S and U+03C2 GREEK SMALL LETTER FINAL SIGMA we should now be in alignment with both other browser and with the Safe Browsing query system.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);

    box-sizing: border-box;

    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;

    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>

                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

              UI>Security>UrlFormatting<a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:UI>Security>UrlFormatting" title="UI>Security>UrlFormatting = [Team-Security-UX] Right-to-left text (“RTL”) or general Unicode issues with URL text display, formatting URLs as origins for security display">

          <td class="">
            <!---->
            <a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Services>Safebrowsing" title="Services>Safebrowsing = Safe Browsing infrastructure within Chrome">

          <!---->
            <a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:UI>Security>UrlFormatting" title="UI>Security>UrlFormatting = [Team-Security-UX] Right-to-left text (“RTL”) or general Unicode issues with URL text display, formatting URLs as origins for security display">
              UI&gt;Security&gt;UrlFormatting<!----></a><br>

          </td>

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (Sep 26, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I kindly want to inform you about a discrepancy within the safe browsing feature, that said Chrome is assessing links in another way than the (manually) online check.<span class="line"><!---->I kindly want to inform you about a discrepancy within the safe browsing feature, that said Chrome is assessing links in another way than the (manually) online check.<!----></span><br><br>As the "Safe Browsing" ought to be in general a product of Chrome, referring to the blog under<span class="line"><!---->As the "Safe Browsing" ought to be in general a product of Chrome, referring to the blog under<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html"><!---->https://security.googleblog.com/2022/08/how-hash-based-safe-browsing-works-in.html<!----></a><br><br>you are getting my accidental finding here.<span class="line"><!---->you are getting my accidental finding here.<!----></span><br><br>Behaviour<span class="line"><!---->Behaviour<!----></span><br>=========<span class="line"><!---->=========<!----></span><br><br>Today I got a phishing attempt for the page<span class="line"><!---->Today I got a phishing attempt for the page<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://www<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www"><!---->https://www<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> marlene baß. com/ 452775/ zjnsapc53s<span class="line"><!----> marlene baß. com/ 452775/ zjnsapc53s<!----></span><br>(Spaces were added by me for security reasons, the path cut)<span class="line"><!---->(Spaces were added by me for security reasons, the path cut)<!----></span><br><br>which was handled as follows:<span class="line"><!---->which was handled as follows:<!----></span><br><br>* Chrome<span class="line"><!---->* Chrome<!----></span><br>  ==> successfully blocked as MALICIOUS<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; successfully blocked as MALICIOUS<!----></span><br><br>* Manual check in Google Transparency Report<span class="line"><!---->* Manual check in Google Transparency Report<!----></span><br>  ==> The site would be CLEAN<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; The site would be CLEAN<!----></span><br>  via <span class="line"><!---->  via <!----></span>https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&hl=en<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&amp;hl=en"><!---->https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search?url=http:%2F%2Fwww.marleneba%C3%9F.com%2F452775%2Fzjnsapc53s&amp;hl=en<!----></a><br><br>* Queried with "SS"<span class="line"><!---->* Queried with "SS"<!----></span><br>  ==> Malicious<span class="line"><!---->  ==&gt; Malicious<!----></span><br><br>Screenshots enclosed.<span class="line"><!---->Screenshots enclosed.<!----></span><br><br><br>Problem<span class="line"><!---->Problem<!----></span><br>==========<span class="line"><!---->==========<!----></span><br><br>The domain obviously contains a German Sharp-S ("ß"), which was translated by Chrome to a double-S ("SS"); thus the block list contains the variant with double-S for the match. So far, so good.<span class="line"><!---->The domain obviously contains a German Sharp-S ("ß"), which was translated by Chrome to a double-S ("SS"); thus the block list contains the variant with double-S for the match. So far, so good.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately, the official Google query mask in the transparency report gives a different result for the provided link, namely that it would be harmless. This is incorrect. Screenshots enclosed.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately, the official Google query mask in the transparency report gives a different result for the provided link, namely that it would be harmless. This is incorrect. Screenshots enclosed.<!----></span><br><br>It gives me the impression that two different algorithms are used here, which lead to different safety-critical results.<span class="line"><!---->It gives me the impression that two different algorithms are used here, which lead to different safety-critical results.<!----></span><br><br>Bad people could use this different handling to their advantage: starting a perfectly layouted phishing campaign as e.g. a bank, with a link to a domain including a "ß" and containing immediately a text hint in the kind of<span class="line"><!---->Bad people could use this different handling to their advantage: starting a perfectly layouted phishing campaign as e.g. a bank, with a link to a domain including a "ß" and containing immediately a text hint in the kind of<!----></span><br><br>"Unfortunately, Chrome is blocking access to the site due to a misconfiguration. We are in contact with Google.<span class="line"><!---->"Unfortunately, Chrome is blocking access to the site due to a misconfiguration. We are in contact with Google.<!----></span><br><br>In the meantime please make sure on the official Google page below<span class="line"><!---->In the meantime please make sure on the official Google page below<!----></span><br><br>* <span class="line"><!---->* <!----></span>https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search"><!---->https://transparencyreport.google.com/safe-browsing/search<!----></a><br><br>where Google confirms to you that the site is safe."<span class="line"><!---->where Google confirms to you that the site is safe."<!----></span><br><br>As said, in my experiences many people (at least five in my very direct surrounding) would really believe that and skip Chrome's warning after checking via the transparency report (Why not: "Google tells it, so it's correct. Silly Chrome."). It doesn't matter that Chrome shows the translated "SS" link because the user used the identical link that he inserted into the query. Nobody pays any attention there; it was the same link.<span class="line"><!---->As said, in my experiences many people (at least five in my very direct surrounding) would really believe that and skip Chrome's warning after checking via the transparency report (Why not: "Google tells it, so it's correct. Silly Chrome."). It doesn't matter that Chrome shows the translated "SS" link because the user used the identical link that he inserted into the query. Nobody pays any attention there; it was the same link.<!----></span><br><br>The catastrophe begins.<span class="line"><!---->The catastrophe begins.<!----></span><br><br>Same with subdomains (examples):<span class="line"><!---->Same with subdomains (examples):<!----></span><br>*<span class="line"><!---->*<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com"><!---->blablablaSS.blablablaaaa.com<!----></a> => malicous<span class="line"><!----> =&gt; malicous<!----></span><br>* blablablaß.blablablaaaa.com => may be, may be not <span class="line"><!---->* blablablaß.blablablaaaa.com =&gt; may be, may be not <!----></span><br><br>That said, the safe browsing function is obviously implemented improperly. I would like to trust Google and Chrome - but currently it is obviously not guaranteed. :o(<span class="line"><!---->That said, the safe browsing function is obviously implemented improperly. I would like to trust Google and Chrome - but currently it is obviously not guaranteed. :o(<!----></span><br><br>Just a thought: Probably there are also other letters causing a similar issue, in the domain and/or the path. I haven't tried.<span class="line"><!---->Just a thought: Probably there are also other letters causing a similar issue, in the domain and/or the path. I haven't tried.<!----></span><br><br>I hope it is clear enough.<span class="line"><!---->I hope it is clear enough.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><br><br><br>* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32-bit)<span class="line"><!---->* ChromeOS v105.0.5195.134 (Offizieller Build) (32-bit)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      drubery@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/644166437" title="drubery@chromium.org"><!---->drubery@chromium.org<!----></a>
      drubery@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->drubery@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 4:58 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          <br>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          mea...@chromium.org cthomp@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing UI&gt;Security&gt;UrlFormatting
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I'm not sure whether this is expected or not because I don't know all the rules about how unicode domains work. If marlenebaß is a different domain from marlenebass, then the site probably redirect you. Then we showed an interstitial warning on marlenebass. In this case, Safe Browsing is correctly reporting that it doesn't see phishing on marlenebaß, only on marlenebass.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure whether this is expected or not because I don't know all the rules about how unicode domains work. If marlenebaß is a different domain from marlenebass, then the site probably redirect you. Then we showed an interstitial warning on marlenebass. In this case, Safe Browsing is correctly reporting that it doesn't see phishing on marlenebaß, only on marlenebass.<!----></span><br><br>On the other hand, if these domains are "the same" in some sense (particularly if Chrome is just doing an ASCII-only display of marlenebaß), then Safe Browsing should probably report the same thing on both.<span class="line"><!---->On the other hand, if these domains are "the same" in some sense (particularly if Chrome is just doing an ASCII-only display of marlenebaß), then Safe Browsing should probably report the same thing on both.<!----></span><br><br>+meacer@, chtomp@ for URL display knowledge - are these two domains the same or different?<span class="line"><!---->+meacer@, chtomp@ for URL display knowledge - are these two domains the same or different?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cthomp@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1324661417" title="cthomp@chromium.org"><!---->cthomp@chromium.org<!----></a>
      cthomp@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cthomp@chromium.org<!----></span>
      OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)" hidden=""><!---->OOO on leave (go/cthomp-ooo)<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368270#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 26, 2022, 9:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think this is a case where Safe Browsing is applying full IDNA2008 (which maintains "ß" the sharp-S unicode character) but Chrome applies IDNA2003/IDN2008-Transitional which normalizes it to "ss". We are in the process of changing this in Chrome to fully move to IDNA2008.<span class="line"><!---->I think this is a case where Safe Browsing is applying full IDNA2008 (which maintains "ß" the sharp-S unicode character) but Chrome applies IDNA2003/IDN2008-Transitional which normalizes it to "ss". We are in the process of changing this in Chrome to fully move to IDNA2008.<!----></span><br><br>What this means is that, in Chrome today for the example domain "faß[.]de" will result in navigating to "fass[.]de". But entering "faß[.]de" in the Safe Browsing tool appears to be referring to the Unicode version (i.e., in Punycode "xn--fa-hia.de") maintaining the sharp-S.<span class="line"><!---->What this means is that, in Chrome today for the example domain "faß[.]de" will result in navigating to "fass[.]de". But entering "faß[.]de" in the Safe Browsing tool appears to be referring to the Unicode version (i.e., in Punycode "xn--fa-hia.de") maintaining the sharp-S.<!----></span><br><br>These are different domains so they can have different results Arguably, full IDNA2008 is "more correct", which is why we're moving Chrome to it. It also aligns us with other browsers. (And this can definitely get added to our list of reasons the switch is helpful.)<span class="line"><!---->These are different domains so they can have different results Arguably, full IDNA2008 is "more correct", which is why we're moving Chrome to it. It also aligns us with other browsers. (And this can definitely get added to our list of reasons the switch is helpful.)<!----></span><br><br>As a stopgap or clarifying measure, it might be helpful for the Safe Browsing page to output the final URL that was checked after normalization. There are a number of other cases where the normalization step can differ depending on URL library, etc. so including this can be a good confirmatory signal that the user is looking at the correct domain/URL.<span class="line"><!---->As a stopgap or clarifying measure, it might be helpful for the Safe Browsing page to output the final URL that was checked after normalization. There are a number of other cases where the normalization step can differ depending on URL library, etc. so including this can be a good confirmatory signal that the user is looking at the correct domain/URL.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Sorry for the lack of updates here. There haven't been any changes internally to the Safe Browsing query system, but we have shipped IDNA 2008 Non-Transitional in Chrome for these cases, so I think Chrome should now be in alignment with the Safe Browsing query system.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for the lack of updates here. There haven't been any changes internally to the Safe Browsing query system, but we have shipped IDNA 2008 Non-Transitional in Chrome for these cases, so I think Chrome should now be in alignment with the Safe Browsing query system.<!----></span><br><br>Closing this as Fixed based on the status of <span class="line"><!---->Closing this as Fixed based on the status of <!----></span>Issue 694157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=694157" title="Use IDNA 2008 with non-transitional processing"><!---->Issue 694157<!----></a>. My understanding is there is some follow-up work needed on <span class="line"><!---->. My understanding is there is some follow-up work needed on <!----></span>Issue 694157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=694157" title="Use IDNA 2008 with non-transitional processing"><!---->Issue 694157<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>specifically for ZWJ/ZWNJ, but for U+00DF LATIN SMALL LETTER SHARP S and U+03C2 GREEK SMALL LETTER FINAL SIGMA we should now be in alignment with both other browser and with the Safe Browsing query system.<span class="line"><!---->specifically for ZWJ/ZWNJ, but for U+00DF LATIN SMALL LETTER SHARP S and U+03C2 GREEK SMALL LETTER FINAL SIGMA we should now be in alignment with both other browser and with the Safe Browsing query system.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
